channel.title: Healthcare on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in Healthcare on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: A hierarchical decomposition for explaining ML performance discrepancies
item.description: New nonparametric framework explains ML performance gaps across domains by hierarchically decomposing discrepancies due to covariate and conditional outcome shifts, offering detailed variable-level at…

item.title: Addressing Asynchronicity in Clinical Multimodal Fusion via Individualized Chest X-ray Generation
item.description: DDL-CXR dynamically generates up-to-date chest X-ray image representations using latent diffusion models, effectively addressing asynchronous multimodal clinical data for improved prediction.

item.title: Association Pattern-aware Fusion for Biological Entity Relationship Prediction
item.description: Pattern-BERP, a novel method, boosts biological entity relationship prediction accuracy by 4-23% using association pattern-aware fusion, enhancing interpretability for real-world applications.

item.title: Automatically Learning Hybrid Digital Twins of Dynamical Systems
item.description: AI autonomously designs highly effective hybrid digital twins by combining neural networks and mechanistic models, significantly advancing digital twin technology.

item.title: Autoregressive Image Diffusion: Generation of Image Sequence and Application in MRI
item.description: Autoregressive Image Diffusion (AID) generates coherent MRI image sequences from undersampled data, outperforming standard diffusion models by exploiting inter-image dependencies.

item.title: Chimera: Effectively Modeling Multivariate Time Series with 2-Dimensional State Space Models
item.description: Chimera: a novel 2D state space model effectively captures complex multivariate time series dependencies, achieving superior forecasting, classification, and anomaly detection.

item.title: Customized Subgraph Selection and Encoding for Drug-drug Interaction Prediction
item.description: AI-powered drug interaction prediction gets a boost! CSSE-DDI uses neural architecture search to customize subgraph selection and encoding, resulting in superior accuracy and efficiency compared to e…

item.title: Data-Driven Discovery of Dynamical Systems in Pharmacology using Large Language Models
item.description: LLMs iteratively discover and refine interpretable dynamical systems models, achieving high accuracy and uncovering new insights; demonstrated by a novel Warfarin model.

item.title: DDGS-CT: Direction-Disentangled Gaussian Splatting for Realistic Volume Rendering
item.description: DDGS-CT: A novel direction-disentangled Gaussian splatting method creates realistic X-ray images from CT scans, boosting accuracy and speed for applications such as image-guided surgery and radiothera…

item.title: Deep Learning in Medical Image Registration: Magic or Mirage?
item.description: Deep learning (DL) image registration methods sometimes underperform classical methods, especially when data distribution shifts; this study reveals when each approach excels.

item.title: DMNet: Self-comparison Driven Model for Subject-independent Seizure Detection
item.description: DMNet: A novel self-comparison driven model significantly improves subject-independent seizure detection from intracranial EEG, outperforming existing methods.

item.title: Double-Ended Synthesis Planning with Goal-Constrained Bidirectional Search
item.description: Double-Ended Synthesis Planning (DESP) significantly boosts computer-aided synthesis planning by using a bidirectional search, outperforming existing methods on multiple benchmarks, especially when sp…

item.title: Du-IN: Discrete units-guided mask modeling for decoding speech from Intracranial Neural signals
item.description: Du-IN: Revolutionizing speech decoding from intracranial neural signals with discrete units-guided mask modeling, achieving state-of-the-art performance on a challenging Chinese word-reading sEEG dat…

item.title: ET-Flow: Equivariant Flow-Matching for Molecular Conformer Generation
item.description: ET-Flow, a novel equivariant flow-matching model, generates highly accurate and physically realistic molecular conformers significantly faster than existing methods.

item.title: Fine-grained Control of Generative Data Augmentation in IoT Sensing
item.description: Fine-grained control is added to generative models for IoT sensing data augmentation, tailoring synthetic data to specific application needs by leveraging domain expertise and statistical metrics of s…

item.title: Free Lunch in Pathology Foundation Model: Task-specific Model Adaptation with Concept-Guided Feature Enhancement
item.description: Boost pathology model accuracy with Concept Anchor-guided Task-specific Feature Enhancement (CATE)! This adaptable paradigm enhances feature extraction for specific tasks using task-relevant concepts,…

item.title: GFlowNet Assisted Biological Sequence Editing
item.description: GFNSeqEditor, a novel biological sequence editing algorithm, efficiently enhances desired properties while minimizing edits using generative flow networks, surpassing existing methods.

item.title: Graph Diffusion Transformers for Multi-Conditional Molecular Generation
item.description: Graph Diffusion Transformer (Graph DiT) masters multi-conditional molecular generation by cleverly integrating property representations into a graph-dependent noise model, achieving superior performan…

item.title: Human Expertise in Algorithmic Prediction
item.description: Boost AI predictions by using human judgment on algorithmically indistinguishable inputs!

item.title: KFNN: K-Free Nearest Neighbor For Crowdsourcing
item.description: KFNN dynamically determines optimal neighborhood sizes for label integration in crowdsourcing, significantly boosting accuracy and robustness, especially with limited noisy labels.

item.title: Leveraging Tumor Heterogeneity: Heterogeneous Graph Representation Learning for Cancer Survival Prediction in Whole Slide Images
item.description: ProtoSurv uses heterogeneous graph representation learning to predict cancer survival more accurately by incorporating tumor heterogeneity and tissue spatial relationships from WSIs.

item.title: Long-range Brain Graph Transformer
item.description: ALTER, a novel brain graph transformer, leverages long-range dependencies to achieve state-of-the-art accuracy in neurological disease diagnosis.

item.title: Med-Real2Sim: Non-Invasive Medical Digital Twins using Physics-Informed Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: Med-Real2Sim uses physics-informed self-supervised learning to build non-invasive medical digital twins, enabling in-silico clinical trials and unsupervised disease detection.

item.title: Medformer: A Multi-Granularity Patching Transformer for Medical Time-Series Classification
item.description: Medformer: A novel multi-granularity patching transformer achieves state-of-the-art performance in medical time series classification, excelling in challenging subject-independent settings.

item.title: MotionTTT: 2D Test-Time-Training Motion Estimation for 3D Motion Corrected MRI
item.description: MotionTTT: Deep learning enables accurate 3D motion-corrected MRI by cleverly estimating motion parameters during test-time training, significantly improving image reconstruction.

item.title: Online Control in Population Dynamics
item.description: This paper introduces a novel, robust online control framework for managing evolving populations, achieving near-optimal control even in complex, noisy systems.

item.title: Physics-Regularized Multi-Modal Image Assimilation for Brain Tumor Localization
item.description: Physics-regularized multi-modal image assimilation improves brain tumor localization by integrating data-driven and physics-based cost functions, achieving state-of-the-art performance in capturing tu…

item.title: realSEUDO for real-time calcium imaging analysis
item.description: realSEUDO: Real-time calcium imaging analysis now possible at speeds exceeding 30 Hz, enabling sophisticated closed-loop neuroscience experiments.

item.title: Reprogramming Pretrained Target-Specific Diffusion Models for Dual-Target Drug Design
item.description: AI-powered dual-target drug design is revolutionized by repurposing pretrained diffusion models, achieving zero-shot transfer learning and outperforming existing methods.

item.title: RGFN: Synthesizable Molecular Generation Using GFlowNets
item.description: Reaction-GFlowNet (RGFN) revolutionizes small molecule discovery by generating synthesizable molecules directly within the chemical reaction space, dramatically expanding the search space for drug dis…

item.title: RoME: A Robust Mixed-Effects Bandit Algorithm for Optimizing Mobile Health Interventions
item.description: RoME, a robust contextual bandit algorithm, leverages mixed-effects modeling and debiased machine learning to optimize personalized mobile health interventions, achieving superior performance in simul…

item.title: Sm: enhanced localization in Multiple Instance Learning for medical imaging classification
item.description: SmMIL enhances medical image classification by introducing a novel smooth operator to improve instance-level localization in multiple instance learning, achieving state-of-the-art results.

item.title: Towards Effective Planning Strategies for Dynamic Opinion Networks
item.description: This study introduces novel, scalable AI-based planning strategies for controlling misinformation spread in dynamic opinion networks, significantly improving infection rate control.

item.title: Trajectory Flow Matching with Applications to Clinical Time Series Modelling
item.description: Simulation-free Neural SDE training via Trajectory Flow Matching unlocks scalability and stability for modeling complex real-world time series, particularly in clinical settings.

item.title: TurboHopp: Accelerated Molecule Scaffold Hopping with Consistency Models
item.description: TurboHopp: 30x faster 3D scaffold hopping with consistency models, boosting drug discovery!

item.title: Unscrambling disease progression at scale: fast inference of event permutations with optimal transport
item.description: Fast disease progression inference is achieved via optimal transport, enabling high-dimensional, interpretable models and offering broad clinical applications.

item.title: Who’s Gaming the System? A Causally-Motivated Approach for Detecting Strategic Adaptation
item.description: Researchers developed a causally-motivated approach for ranking agents based on their gaming propensity, addressing the challenge of identifying ‘worst offenders’ in strategic classification settings.

item.title: xMIL: Insightful Explanations for Multiple Instance Learning in Histopathology
item.description: xMIL-LRP: Enhanced explainable AI for multiple instance learning in histopathology, boosting model transparency and enabling new knowledge discovery.
